<script type="text/javascript">
var main_site_url = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
var maindomain_lang = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
function getParameterByName(name, url) {
		if(url == null){
		  url = window.location.href;
		}
	    name = name.replace(/[\[\]]/g, '\\$&');
	    var regex = new RegExp('[?&]' + name + '(=([^&#]*)|&|#|$)'),
		results = regex.exec(url);
	    if (!results) return null;
	    if (!results[2]) return '';
	    return decodeURIComponent(results[2].replace(/\+/g, ' '));
	}
	var container_q = getParameterByName('container');
	var d_lang = 'en';	
</script>

	<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO Premium plugin v23.7 (Yoast SEO v23.7) - https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/ -->
	<title>NetTraveler Spear-Phishing Email Targets Diplomat of Uzbekistan</title>
	<meta name="description" content="Unit 42 recently identified a targeted attack against an individual working for the Foreign Ministry of Uzbekistan in China, named the NetTraveler Trojan." />
	<link rel="canonical" href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan/" />
	<meta property="og:locale" content="en_US" />
	<meta property="og:type" content="article" />
	<meta property="og:title" content="NetTraveler Spear-Phishing Email Targets Diplomat of Uzbekistan" />
	<meta property="og:description" content="Unit 42 recently identified a targeted attack against an individual working for the Foreign Ministry of Uzbekistan in China, named the NetTraveler Trojan." />
	<meta property="og:url" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan/" />
	<meta property="og:site_name" content="Unit 42" />
	<meta property="article:published_time" content="2016-01-21T06:45:39+00:00" />

<meta property="og:likes" content="4"/>
<meta property="og:readtime" content="7"/>
<meta property="og:views" content="49,310"/>
<meta property="og:date_created" content="January 21, 2016 at 8:45 AM"/>
<meta property="og:post_length" content="1792"/>
<meta property="og:category" content="Malware"/>
<meta property="og:category" content="Threat Research"/>
<meta property="og:category_link" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/category/malware/"/>
<meta property="og:category_link" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/category/threat-research/"/>
<meta property="og:author" content="Vicky Ray"/>
<meta property="og:author" content="Robert Falcone"/>
<meta property="og:authorlink" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/author/vicky-khan/"/>
<meta property="og:authorlink" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/author/robertfalcone/"/>
<meta property="og:author_image_link" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/unit-news-meta.svg"/>
<meta property="og:author_image_link" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/unit-news-meta.svg"/>
<meta name="post_tags" content="NetTraveler,Spear Phishing,Trojan,Ufa,Ufe,Uzbekistan"/>
<script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"BlogPosting","headline":"NetTraveler Spear-Phishing Email Targets Diplomat of Uzbekistan","name":"NetTraveler Spear-Phishing Email Targets Diplomat of Uzbekistan","description":"Unit 42 recently identified a targeted attack against an individual working for the Foreign Ministry of\u00a0Uzbekistan in China. A spear-phishing email was sent to a diplomat of the Embassy of Uzbekistan who is likely based in Beijing, China. In this report, we\u2019ll review how the actors attempted to exploit CVE-2012-0158 to install the NetTraveler Trojan.","url":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan\/","mainEntityOfPage":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan\/","datePublished":"January 21, 2016","articleBody":"Unit 42 recently identified a targeted attack against an individual working for the Foreign Ministry of\u00a0Uzbekistan in China. A spear-phishing email was sent to a diplomat of the Embassy of Uzbekistan who is likely based in Beijing, China. In this report, we\u2019ll review how the actors attempted to exploit CVE-2012-0158 to install the NetTraveler Trojan.\n\nOn December 12, 2015, a spear-phishing email was sent to a diplomat of the Embassy of Uzbekistan. The body and subject of the email suggests that the email was spoofed to look like it was sent by the Russian Foreign Ministry and the attachment may contain an official annual report on CHS (Council of Heads of Member States), who form the SCO (Shanghai Cooperation Organization).\n\nFilename: \u201c2015.12.11_\u0441\u0440\u043e\u043a\u0438 \u0421\u0413\u0413 2015 \u0432 \u0423\u0444\u0435.doc.doc\u201d (translated to: \u201c2015.12.11_sroki CHS in 2015 Ufe.doc.doc\u201d)\n\nBody: \u201c\u0421 \u0443\u0432\u0430\u0436\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435\u043c, \u0414\u0410\u0422\u0421 \u041c\u0418\u0414 \u0420\u043e\u0441\u0441\u0438\u0438\u201d (translated to: \u201cYours faithfully, ACSD Russian Foreign Ministry\u201d)\n\nIt is interesting to note the reference of Ufa in the file name, as the city of Ufa in Russia hosted the SCO BRICS Summit on July 9 and 10, 2015. SCO and BRICS (Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa) are intergovernmental international organizations focused on issues of regional security and economic cooperation.\n\n\nFigure 1 Leaders of member nations at the 2015 Summit in Ufa\n\nTARGETING AND MALWARE ANALYSIS\nOur analysis shows that actors attempted to exploit CVE-2012-0158 to install NetTraveler Trojan.\n\n\nFigure 2 Email containing the malicious attachment\nThe malicious attachment \u201c2015.12.11_\u0441\u0440\u043e\u043a\u0438 \u0421\u0413\u0413 2015 \u0432 \u0423\u0444\u0435.doc.doc\u201d is a malicious document created by the MNKit toolkit and exploits CVE-2012-0158.\n\nUpon successful exploitation, the attachment will install the trojan known as NetTraveler using a DLL side-loading attack technique. The NetTraveler trojan has been known to be used in targeted cyber espionage attacks for more than a decade by nation state threat actors and continues to be used to target its victims and exfiltrate data.\n\nThe DLL side-loading attack technique has been gaining adoption within the cyber espionage realm by threat actors to bypass traditional security systems. Unit 42 also published a blog last year discussing an unrelated attack where the DLL side-loading technique was used.\n\nFigure 3 illustrates the exploitation and the infection flow of the malware.\n\n\nFigure 3 Overview of the infection flow \nThe document \u201c2015.12.11_\u0441\u0440\u043e\u043a\u0438 \u0421\u0413\u0413 2015 \u0432 \u0423\u0444\u0435.doc.doc\u201d exploits CVE-2012-0158 to drop a decoy file \u201c~$.doc\u201d and the actual payload \u201cDW20.exe\u201d. The decoy is a blank document with the meta data stripped.\n\nThe payload (DW20.exe) is a self-extracting (SFX) RAR archive that contains the following files:\n\nRasTls.exe\nrastls.dll\nSycmentec.config\n\n\nFigure 4 The payload(DW20.exe) is a SFX RAR archive\nThe SFX RAR uses the following configuration to launch the embedded executable, which is a legitimate application created by Symantec that will side load the rastls.dll DLL:\n\nSetup=RasTls.exe\nTempMode\nSilent=1\nOverwrite=1\n\nThe figure below shows that the config file, \u2018Sycmentec.config\u2019 is encrypted.\n\nThe \u2018Sycmentec.config\u2019 file can be decrypted using a single byte XOR algorithm using \u20180x77\u2019 as a key.\n\n\nFigure 5 Encrypted \u2018Sycmentec.config\u2019file\nThe \u2018rastls.dll\u2019 DLL will load and decrypt this file. The decrypted data starts with shellcode that is responsible for loading an embedded DLL and executing it.\n\nFigure 6 shows the decrypted \u2018Sycmentec.config\u2019file containing an embedded DLL.\n\n\nFigure 6 Decrypted \u2018Sycmentec.config\u2019 file contains an embedded DLL\nThe embedded DLL is the functional payload, which is a variant of the NetTraveler Trojan that has the following attributes:\n\n\n\nSize\n52736 bytes\n\n\nType\nPE32 executable (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386, for MS Windows\n\n\nArchitecture \n32 Bits binary\n\n\nMD5\n3e3df4fe831d87d7f52f14933e464fc3\n\n\nSHA1\ncce65a0b67674a313091a947506ceb91d30605ad\n\n\nSHA256\n3b4e4d7a0b1185a45968d90ffe6346f4621116d14dbf88b5138040acc022c757\n\n\nssdeep\n1536:jxKW1S8mWKFU7U9lYjhjXwVqTvS\/G405:wCBmUw9lAhLWqW\/G40\n\n\nimphash\n85ce31f87f06b02fec915d33d82958e8\n\n\nDate\n0x564B2B07 [Tue Nov 17 13:26:31 2015 UTC]\n\n\nCRC:(Claimed)\n0x0, (Actual): 0x19be0 [SUSPICIOUS]\n\n\nPackers\nArmadillo v1.xx - v2.xx\n\n\nEntry Point\n0x1000970b .text 1\/5\n\n\n\nTable 1 Attributes of the embedded DLL (NetTraveler)\n\nThe first execution of this NetTraveler Trojan starts off with an installation process. Like previous versions, this NetTraveler sample writes its configuration to a file, in this case the configuration is written to a file named \"config.dat\".\n\n\nFigure 7 NetTraveler writes the configuration to \u2018config.dat\u2019 file\nDuring execution, NetTraveler creates a mutex of \u2018YOYWOW!657\u2019, as shown in Figure 8 below to avoid running multiple instances of its code.\n\n\nFigure 8 Mutex created for this NetTraveler payload\nThe code then enumerates the 'netsvcs' services, which are services that run within the process space of svchost.exe, specifically ignoring services named \u20186to4\u2019 and \u2018Ias\u2019 as these services have been used by other malware families.\n\nWhen it finds another netsvcs service with a name not matching these two names, it will delete the file associated with the service and copy the \u2018rastls.dll\u2019 file to that folder using \u2018&lt;service name&gt;ve.dll\u2019 as the filename as shown in Figure 9 below.\n\n\nFigure 9 Code enumerating \u2018netsvcs\u2019 services\n\nFigure 10 Renamed \u2018rastls.dll\u2019 DLL\n\u00a0The malware will then change the binary path of the service to point to this new filename and copies the \"Sycmentec.config\" file to the same folder and the \u2018config.dat\u2019 file to the following location:\n\nc:\\windows\\system\\CERTAPL.DLL\n\nThe NetTraveler payload relies on the \u2018rastls.dll\u2019 file to obtain its C2 server. At first glance, the NetTraveler payload appears as if it will use the following URL for its C2 server:\n\nhttp:\/\/192.168.3[.]201\/downloader2013\/asp\/downloader.asp\n\nHowever, the NetTraveler payload reads the last \u20180xb0\u2019 bytes from the rastls.dll file and uses it to create the \"config.dat\" file that is later saved to \"CERTAPL.DLL\". This technique hides the true C2 server from researchers that do not have access to both the rastls.dll and Sycmentec.config files.\n\n\nFigure 11 Code snippet showing NetTraveler obtaining its configuration from rastls.dll.\nThe configuration file is structured as an \".ini\" file as the Trojan uses GetPrivateProfileStringA to parse the contents. The configuration file has the following contents:\n[OOOOOO]\nU00P=r^?&lt;80&gt;}H&gt;?&lt;88&gt;&lt;89&gt;&lt;8A&gt;B&lt;8B&gt;&lt;85&gt;|&lt;86&gt;&lt;87&gt;&lt;89&gt;&lt;91&gt;&lt;8B&gt;&lt;90&gt;&lt;92&gt;&lt;88&gt;N&lt;84&gt;&lt;91&gt;&lt;90&gt;S&lt;94&gt;&lt;96&gt;&lt;9B&gt;&lt;8C&gt;&lt;8E&gt;&lt;9E&gt;Z&lt;95&gt;&lt;9B&gt;&lt;92&gt;&lt;94&gt;&lt;A8&gt;_&lt;93&gt;&lt;A6&gt;&lt;A4&gt;\nK00P=XLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\\]^_`abcdefghiv\nP00D=5\nF00G=True\nMM1=0\nMM6=1\n\nUnit 42 analyzed the sample and found the following configuration fields that could appear in the CERTAPL.DLL configuration file and a brief description of each field:\nU00P = C2 URL\nK00P = Key for DES\nP00D = Sleep interval in minutes\nF00G = Boolean to determine if sample should use proxy to communicate with C2 server\nMM1 = 0 or 1 if proxy is configured or not.\nMM3 = Port for configured proxy\nMM4 = Username for configured proxy\nMM5 = Password for configured proxy\nMM6 = 1 if Trojan is installed correctly\nThe \"U00P\" and \"K00P\" values are decrypted using a simple algorithm that subtracts the index and then subtracts ten from each character, which is depicted in the following:\ndef subtraction_algo(ct):\n  out = \"\"\n  i = 0\n  for e in ct:\n    out += chr(ord(e)-i-10)\n    i += 1\n  return out\n\nThese two fields decrypt to the following, the U00P value being the C2 URL and the K00P value being the basis for an encryption key for the DES algorithm:\n\nU00P: http:\/\/www.voennovosti.com\/optdet\/index.asp (decrypted)\n\nK00P: NAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAM (decrypted)\n\nThe C2 server will respond to requests issued by the Trojan with commands to carry out activities on the compromised system. We analyzed the code within NetTraveler that handles commands issued by the C2 server and found four available commands that are listed in Table 2.\n\n\n\nCommand\nDescription\n\n\n&lt;Unique System ID&gt;:UNINSTALL\nDeletes %APPDATA%\\cert2013.dat and %STARTUP%\\consent.lnk and exits the process. This attempts to uninstall the Trojan, but will not work as the filenames are not used by this version of NetTraveler\n\n\n&lt;Unique System ID&gt;:RUN_REBOOT\nReboots the system\n\n\n&lt;Unique System ID&gt;:RUN_STARTUP\nDownloads a file to %TEMP%\\Temp.bmp and copies it to the startup folder\n\n\n&lt;Unique System ID&gt;:RUN_DIRECT\nDownload a file to %TEMP%\\tmp.bmp and execute it\n\n\n\nTable 2 Commands available within NetTraveler and a description of their functionality\nINFRASTRUCTURE\nAt the time of analysis, the domain voennovosti[.]com was resolving to IP \u201898.126.38[.]107\u2019, which is hosted by Krypt Technologies. A report published by Kaspersky Labs in 2011 on NetTraveler also mentions the C2 servers were being hosted by Krypt Technolgies. This web hosting service provider continues to be the hosting provider of choice for the threat actors behind NetTraveler.\n\n\nFigure 12 DNS query for voennovosti[.]com resolves to \u201898.126.38.107\u2019\n\nFigure 13 Encoded network communications\n\nCONCLUSION\nNetTraveler has been used to target diplomats, embassies and government institutions for over a decade, and remains the tool of choice by the adversaries behind these cyber espionage campaigns. The use of NetTraveler for such a long period of time shows its effectiveness and success by the adversaries in targeting their victims with impunity.\n\nAs seen in this case, the threat actors continue to evolve and employ new techniques within their modus operandi, like \u2018DLL side-loading\u2019 to install malware. It is likely that the use of \u2018DLL side loading\u2019 attack technique will increase due to it\u2019s effectiveness to bypass traditional security systems.\n\nIt is essential to raise awareness on such attacks to better protect organizations from adversaries who maybe backed by nation states.\n\nWildFire correctly classifies NetTraveler as malicious. AutoFocus tags are created to identify NetTraveler samples and respective IOCs are added to Palo Alto Networks Threat Prevention.\nINDICATORS\n\n\n\nSHA256 Hash\nFile Name\n\n\n3f4fcde99775b83bc88d30ca99f5c70c1dd8b96d970dbfd5a846b46c6ea3e534\n2015.12.11_\u0441\u0440\u043e\u043a\u0438 \u0421\u0413\u0413 2015 \u0432 \u0423\u0444\u0435.doc.doc\n\n\n001fff6c09497f56532e83e998aaa80690a668883b6655129d408dd098bd1b4b\nDW20.exe\n\n\n74db11900499aa74be9e62d51889e7611eb8161cd141b9379e05eeca9d7175c9\nrastls.dll\n\n\n8f6af103bf7e3201045ce6c2af41f7a17ef671f33f297d36d2aab8640d00b0f0\nSycmentec.config\n\n\n495bb9c680f114b255f92448e784563e4fd34ad19cf616cc537bec6245931b7e\nconfig.dat\n\n\n41650cb6b4ae9f06c92628208d024845026c19af1ab3916c99c80c6457bd4fa9\nCERTAPL.DLL\n\n\n3b4e4d7a0b1185a45968d90ffe6346f4621116d14dbf88b5138040acc022c757\n(NetTraveler DLL payload)\n\n\n\nCommand and Control\n\nvoennovosti[.]com\n98.126.38[.]107\nREFERENCES\n\n\thttps:\/\/securelist.com\/blog\/research\/35936\/nettraveler-is-running-red-star-apt-attacks-compromise-high-profile-victims\/\n\thttps:\/\/www.fireeye.com\/blog\/threat-research\/2014\/04\/dll-side-loading-another-blind-spot-for-anti-virus.html\n\thttp:\/\/blog.paloaltonetworks.com\/2015\/05\/plugx-uses-legitimate-samsung-application-for-dll-side-loading\/\n\thttp:\/\/indianexpress.com\/article\/business\/business-others\/10-years-on-sco-decides-to-induct-india-as-full-member\/\n\thttps:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Shanghai_Cooperation_Organisation\n\thttp:\/\/ufa2015.com\/\n","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","@id":"#panworg"},"image":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"","width":"","height":""},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","xPath":["\/html\/head\/title","\/html\/head\/meta[@name='description']\/@content"]},"author":[{"@type":"Person","name":"Vicky Ray"},{"@type":"Person","name":"Robert Falcone"}]}</script><link rel='stylesheet' id='crayon-css' href='https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/plugins/crayon-syntax-highlighter/css/min/crayon.min.css?ver=_2.7.2_beta' media='all' />

:root{--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--square: 1;--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--4-3: 4/3;--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--3-4: 3/4;--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--3-2: 3/2;--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--2-3: 2/3;--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--16-9: 16/9;--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--9-16: 9/16;--wp--preset--color--black: #000000;--wp--preset--color--cyan-bluish-gray: #abb8c3;--wp--preset--color--white:     <script type="text/javascript">
    ;(function(win, doc, style, timeout) {
    var STYLE_ID = 'at-body-style';
    function getParent() {
    return doc.getElementsByTagName('head')[0];
    }
    function addStyle(parent, id, def) {
        if (!parent) {
        return;
        }
        var style = doc.createElement('style');
        style.id = id;
        style.innerHTML = def;
        parent.appendChild(style);
    }
    function removeStyle(parent, id) {
        if (!parent) {
            return;
        }
        var style = doc.getElementById(id);
        if (!style) {
            return;
        }
        parent.removeChild(style);
    }
    addStyle(getParent(), STYLE_ID, style);
    setTimeout(function() {
    removeStyle(getParent(), STYLE_ID);
    }, timeout);
    }(window, document, "body {visibility:hidden !important}", 3000));
    </script>

            <script src="https://assets.adobedtm.com/9273d4aedcd2/0d76ae0322d7/launch-425c423d843b.min.js" async></script>
            <script type="text/javascript" src="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/content/dam/pan/en_US/includes/attribution.js"></script>


<script type="text/javascript">
var isIE11 = !!navigator.userAgent.match(/Trident.*rv\:11\./);
if(isIE11){
    var polyfill = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/scripts/polyfill.min.js';
    document.write('<script type="text/javascript" src="'+polyfill+'">\x3C/script>');
}
    /**
 * String.prototype.replaceAll() polyfill
 * https://gomakethings.com/how-to-replace-a-section-of-a-string-with-another-one-with-vanilla-js/
 * @author Chris Ferdinandi
 * @license MIT
 */
if (!String.prototype.replaceAll) {
	String.prototype.replaceAll = function(str, newStr){
		// If a regex pattern
		if (Object.prototype.toString.call(str).toLowerCase() === '[object regexp]') {
			return this.replace(str, newStr);
		}
		// If a string
		return this.replace(new RegExp(str, 'g'), newStr);
	};
}

    /*! lozad.js - v1.16.0 - 2020-09-06 */
!function(t,e){"object"==typeof exports&&"undefined"!=typeof module?module.exports=e():"function"==typeof define&&define.amd?define(e):t.lozad=e()}(this,function(){"use strict";
/**
   * Detect IE browser
   * @const {boolean}
   * @private
   */var g="undefined"!=typeof document&&document.documentMode,f={rootMargin:"0px",threshold:0,load:function(t){if("picture"===t.nodeName.toLowerCase()){var e=t.querySelector("img"),r=!1;null===e&&(e=document.createElement("img"),r=!0),g&&t.getAttribute("data-iesrc")&&(e.src=t.getAttribute("data-iesrc")),t.getAttribute("data-alt")&&(e.alt=t.getAttribute("data-alt")),r&&t.append(e)}if("video"===t.nodeName.toLowerCase()&&!t.getAttribute("data-src")&&t.children){for(var a=t.children,o=void 0,i=0;i<=a.length-1;i++)(o=a[i].getAttribute("data-src"))&&(a[i].src=o);t.load()}t.getAttribute("data-poster")&&(t.poster=t.getAttribute("data-poster")),t.getAttribute("data-src")&&(t.src=t.getAttribute("data-src")),t.getAttribute("data-srcset")&&t.setAttribute("srcset",t.getAttribute("data-srcset"));var n=",";if(t.getAttribute("data-background-delimiter")&&(n=t.getAttribute("data-background-delimiter")),t.getAttribute("data-background-image"))t.style.backgroundImage="url('"+t.getAttribute("data-background-image").split(n).join("'),url('")+"')";else if(t.getAttribute("data-background-image-set")){var d=t.getAttribute("data-background-image-set").split(n),u=d[0].substr(0,d[0].indexOf(" "))||d[0];// Substring before ... 1x
u=-1===u.indexOf("url(")?"url("+u+")":u,1===d.length?t.style.backgroundImage=u:t.setAttribute("style",(t.getAttribute("style")||"")+"background-image: "+u+"; background-image: -webkit-image-set("+d+"); background-image: image-set("+d+")")}t.getAttribute("data-toggle-class")&&t.classList.toggle(t.getAttribute("data-toggle-class"))},loaded:function(){}};function A(t){t.setAttribute("data-loaded",!0)}var m=function(t){return"true"===t.getAttribute("data-loaded")},v=function(t){var e=1<arguments.length&&void 0!==arguments[1]?arguments[1]:document;return t instanceof Element?[t]:t instanceof NodeList?t:e.querySelectorAll(t)};return function(){var r,a,o=0<arguments.length&&void 0!==arguments[0]?arguments[0]:".lozad",t=1<arguments.length&&void 0!==arguments[1]?arguments[1]:{},e=Object.assign({},f,t),i=e.root,n=e.rootMargin,d=e.threshold,u=e.load,g=e.loaded,s=void 0;"undefined"!=typeof window&&window.IntersectionObserver&&(s=new IntersectionObserver((r=u,a=g,function(t,e){t.forEach(function(t){(0<t.intersectionRatio||t.isIntersecting)&&(e.unobserve(t.target),m(t.target)||(r(t.target),A(t.target),a(t.target)))})}),{root:i,rootMargin:n,threshold:d}));for(var c,l=v(o,i),b=0;b<l.length;b++)(c=l[b]).getAttribute("data-placeholder-background")&&(c.style.background=c.getAttribute("data-placeholder-background"));return{observe:function(){for(var t=v(o,i),e=0;e<t.length;e++)m(t[e])||(s?s.observe(t[e]):(u(t[e]),A(t[e]),g(t[e])))},triggerLoad:function(t){m(t)||(u(t),A(t),g(t))},observer:s}}});

</script>

<!-- <script src="https://www.google.com/recaptcha/api.js"></script>  -->

<!--  End: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->

</head>
<body class="post-template-default single single-post postid-11884 single-format-standard no-sidebar">
<header class="haeder py-15 position-relative z-index-2" style="display: none;">
  <div class="container px-sm-30 px-35">
    <div class="row">

                        <a href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/">
                <img src="/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/PANW_Parent.png" width="140px" alt="Logo" />
            </a>
        </div>
      <div class="col-sm-auto col-6 text-sm-center order-sm-2 order-4 second-logo-unit">
        <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/">
            <img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/unit42-logo-white.svg" class="attachment-full size-full" alt="Unit42 Logo"  width="150" height="35"/>
        </a>

      <div class="col-auto d-sm-none ml-auto mb-40 order-2">

<nav id="navigation" class="site-nav collapse d-sm-block pb-20 mt-sm-10"  style="display: none!important;">
  <div class="container px-sm-30">
    <ul id="menu-primary-navigation" class="main-menu d-sm-flex font-weight-medium"><li id="menu-item-97290" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-97290"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tools/">Tools</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-41" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-41"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/atoms/">ATOMs</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-119884" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-119884"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener" href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/unit42">Security Consulting</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-81229" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-81229"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/about-unit-42/">About Us</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-121229" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-121229"><a href="https://start.paloaltonetworks.com/contact-unit42.html"><b style="color:#C84727">Under Attack?</b></a></li>
</ul>  </div>
</nav>
<div class="panClean pan-template-home" id="main-nav-menu-cont" style="display:none;">
    <div class="cleanHeader mainNavigationComp baseComponent parbase">
        <div class="productNav2021Component dark default" id="PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC">
        </div>
  </div>
<div class="cleanTopHtml htmlComp baseComponent parbase"><div class="base-component-spacer spacer-none  "></div>
</div>

<!--  Start: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->
<script type="text/javascript">
	function getCookie(cname) {
	 	var name = cname + "=";
  		var decodedCookie = decodeURIComponent(document.cookie);
		var ca = decodedCookie.split(';');
  		for(var i = 0; i <ca.length; i++) {
    			var c = ca[i];
    			while (c.charAt(0) == ' ') {
     				 c = c.substring(1);
    			}
    			if (c.indexOf(name) == 0) {
    				 return c.substring(name.length, c.length);
    			}
  		}
  		return "";
	}

	var referer = "";//sessionStorage.container;
	var pcontainer = sessionStorage.getItem("container");
	var searchResultsPagePath = "";
	if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Prisma')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Prisma' ;
	}
        else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Cortex')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Cortex' ;
	}
        else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Sase')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Sase' ;
	}
	else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Unit')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Unit' ;
	}
	else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Ngfw')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Ngfw' ;
	}
        var fromRef = document.referrer;
        var nContainer = getCookie("navContainer");
        if(nContainer){//If user is coming from main site, we need to reset the container		
		if(fromRef  && fromRef.indexOf("prismacloud.io")!=-1){
                        referer = 'Prisma' ;
                        sessionStorage.setItem("container","Prisma");
                } else if(fromRef.indexOf("paloaltonetworks.com")!=-1 || fromRef.indexOf("paloaltonetworks.jp")!=-1 ){
                        if(nContainer.indexOf('Prisma') != -1){
                            referer = 'Prisma' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Prisma");
                        }
                        if(nContainer.indexOf('Cortex') != -1){
                            referer = 'Cortex' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Cortex");
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Sase') != -1){
                            referer = 'Sase' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Sase");
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Unit') != -1){
                            referer = 'Unit' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Unit");
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Ngfw') != -1){
                            referer = 'Ngfw' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Ngfw");
                        }
			document.cookie = 'navContainer=; path=/; domain=.paloaltonetworks.com; expires=' + new Date(0).toUTCString();
		}
	}
if(referer != "Prisma" && referer != "Cortex" && referer != "Sase" && referer != "Unit" && referer != "Ngfw") {
    referer = 'Unit' ;
    sessionStorage.setItem("container","Unit");
}
function callMainSitePrismaNavHTML(){
    
    var referrer_domain = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
    sessionStorage.setItem("domain",referrer_domain);
    if(referer == 'Prisma'){
        var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderPrisma.prismaRenderer.html';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/prismasearch";
        }
    if(referer == 'Cortex'){
        var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderCortex.cortexRenderer.html';	
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/cortexsearch";	
    }
    if(referer == 'Sase'){
        var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderSase.saseRenderer.html';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/sasesearch";
    }
    if(referer == 'Unit'){
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/content/pan/en_US/search/unit42search";
		    }
    if(referer == 'Ngfw'){
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/ngfw-cdss-nav-renderer.php';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/ngfwcdsssearch";
    }
    httpGet(menu_url,'menu_html');
    document.getElementById('main-nav-menu-cont').removeAttribute("style");
}
function addStyle(styles) {            
    /* Create style document */
    var css = document.createElement('style');
    css.type = 'text/css';

    if (css.styleSheet) 
        css.styleSheet.cssText = styles;
    else 
        css.appendChild(document.createTextNode(styles));

    /* Append style to the tag name */
    document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(css);
}
function httpGet(theUrl,req_type) {
    if (window.XMLHttpRequest) { // code for IE7+, Firefox, Chrome, Opera, Safari
        xmlhttp=new XMLHttpRequest();
    } else {// code for IE6, IE5
        xmlhttp=new ActiveXObject("Microsoft.XMLHTTP");
    }
    xmlhttp.onreadystatechange=function()
    {
        if (xmlhttp.readyState==4 && xmlhttp.status==200)
        {
            if(req_type == 'menu_html'){
            var nav_text = xmlhttp.responseText.replaceAll('https://static.cloud.coveo.com/searchui/v2.9159/js/CoveoJsSearch.Lazy.min.js', '');
            nav_text = nav_text.replaceAll('src="/', 'src="'+maindomain_lang+'/');
            nav_text = nav_text.replaceAll("'/content", "'"+maindomain_lang+"/content");
                        
            document.getElementById("PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC").innerHTML = nav_text.replaceAll('href="/', 'href="'+maindomain_lang+'/');

            var lozad_back = document.getElementsByClassName('lozad-background');
            Array.prototype.forEach.call(lozad_back, function(el) {
            // Do stuff here
            var el_back_img_path = el.getAttribute('data-background-image');
            var first_pos = el_back_img_path.indexOf("'");
            var last_pos = el_back_img_path.indexOf("'",first_pos+1);
            el_back_img_path = el_back_img_path.substring(first_pos+1,last_pos);
            el.setAttribute("data-background-image",main_site_url+el_back_img_path);
            });
            }
            if(req_type == 'head_inline_css'){
            addStyle(xmlhttp.responseText);
            }
        }
    }
    xmlhttp.open("GET", theUrl, true );
    xmlhttp.send();    
}    
    
if(referer == 'Prisma' || referer == 'Cortex' || referer == 'Sase' || referer == 'Unit' || referer == 'Ngfw'){
    const article = document.querySelector('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC');
    if(referer == 'Prisma'){
        article.dataset.type = 'prisma';
        $('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC').removeClass('default').addClass('defaultRedesigned');
    }
    else if(referer == 'Cortex'){
        article.dataset.type = 'cortex';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Sase'){
        article.dataset.type = 'sase';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Unit'){
        article.dataset.type = 'unit';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Ngfw'){
        article.dataset.type = 'ngfw';
    }
    //set class to default
    if(referer == 'Unit' || referer == 'Ngfw'){
        $('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC').removeClass('default').addClass('defaultRedesigned');
    }
    callMainSitePrismaNavHTML();        
}
</script>
<!--  End: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->

    <section class="section section--article">
        <div class="pa article-banner" style="background-image:url('https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/article-banner.jpg')">
          <div class="l-container"> 
            <div class="l-breadcrumbs"> 
              <ul> <li> <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com" role="link" title="Threat Research" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:hero:breadcrumb:Threat Research">Threat Research Center</a></li><li><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/category/threat-research/" role="link" title="Threat Research" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:hero:breadcrumb:Threat Research">Threat Research</a></li><li class="is-current"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/category/malware/" role="link" title="Malware" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:hero:breadcrumb:Malware">Malware</a></li> </ul>

              <a class="card-category" href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/category/malware/" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:hero:Malware"><span class="ab-title__pre">Malware</span></a> 
              <h1>NetTraveler Spear-Phishing Email Targets Diplomat of Uzbekistan</h1>
              <div class="ab__video">
              <span class="duration">

				</li>
				<li role="menuitem">
					<a href="//www.reddit.com/submit?url=https%3A%2F%2Funit42.paloaltonetworks.com%2Fnettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan%2F" target="_blank" role="link" title="Share in Reddit" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:share:reddit"> <img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/icons/icon-reddit-share.svg" alt="Reddit Icon"></a>
				</li>
				<li role="menuitem">
					<a href="https://mastodon.social/share?text=NetTraveler%20Spear-Phishing%20Email%20Targets%20Diplomat%20of%20Uzbekistan%20https%3A%2F%2Funit42.paloaltonetworks.com%2Fnettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan%2F" target="_blank" role="link" title="Share in Mastodon" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:share:mastodon"> <img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/icons/icon-mastodon-share.svg" alt="Mastodon Icon"></a>
				</li>
	  </ul>
    </div>                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </section> 
    <section class="section blog-contents"> 
      <div class="pa blog-editor">
        <div class="l-container">
          <div class="be__wrapper">
            <div class="be__contents">
              <div class="be__contents-wrapper">
                <p>Unit 42 recently identified a targeted attack against an individual working for the Foreign Ministry of Uzbekistan in China. A spear-phishing email was sent to a diplomat of the Embassy of Uzbekistan who is likely based in Beijing, China. In this report, we’ll review how the actors attempted to exploit CVE-2012-0158 to install the NetTraveler Trojan.</p>
<p>On December 12, 2015, a spear-phishing email was sent to a diplomat of the Embassy of Uzbekistan. The body and subject of the email suggests that the email was spoofed to look like it was sent by the Russian Foreign Ministry and the attachment may contain an official annual report on CHS (Council of Heads of Member States), who form the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shanghai_Cooperation_Organisation">SCO</a> (Shanghai Cooperation Organization).<span id="more-11884"></span></p>
<p><em>Filename: “2015.12.11_сроки СГГ 2015 в Уфе.doc.doc” (translated to: “2015.12.11_sroki CHS in 2015 Ufe.doc.doc”)</em></p>
<p><em>Body: “С уважением, ДАТС МИД России” (translated to: “Yours faithfully, ACSD Russian Foreign Ministry”)</em></p>
<p>It is interesting to note the reference of Ufa in the file name, as the city of Ufa in Russia hosted the <a href="https://ufa2015.com/">SCO BRICS Summit</a> on July 9 and 10, 2015. SCO and BRICS (Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa) are intergovernmental international organizations focused on issues of regional security and economic cooperation.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-1.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11885 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-1-500x281.png" alt="diplomat 1" width="500" height="281" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 1 Leaders of member nations at the 2015 Summit in Ufa</em></p>
<h3>TARGETING AND MALWARE ANALYSIS</h3>
<p>Our analysis shows that actors attempted to exploit CVE-2012-0158 to install NetTraveler Trojan.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-2.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11886 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-2-500x341.png" alt="diplomat 2" width="500" height="341" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 2 Email containing the malicious attachment</em></p>
<p>The malicious attachment “2015.12.11_сроки СГГ 2015 в Уфе.doc.doc” is a malicious document created by the MNKit toolkit and exploits CVE-2012-0158.</p>
<p>Upon successful exploitation, the attachment will install the trojan known as NetTraveler using a <a href="https://www.fireeye.com/content/dam/fireeye-www/global/en/current-threats/pdfs/rpt-dll-sideloading.pdf">DLL side-loading</a> attack technique. The <a href="https://kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/vlpdfs/kaspersky-the-net-traveler-part1-final.pdf">NetTraveler</a> trojan has been known to be used in targeted cyber espionage attacks for <a href="https://securelist.com/blog/research/66272/nettraveler-apt-gets-a-makeover-for-10th-birthday/">more than a decade</a> by nation state threat actors and continues to be used to target its victims and exfiltrate data.</p>
<p>The DLL side-loading attack technique has been gaining adoption within the cyber espionage realm by threat actors to bypass traditional security systems. Unit 42 also published a <a href="https://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/2015/05/plugx-uses-legitimate-samsung-application-for-dll-side-loading/">blog</a> last year discussing an unrelated attack where the DLL side-loading technique was used.</p>
<p>Figure 3 illustrates the exploitation and the infection flow of the malware.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-3.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11887 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-3-500x670.png" alt="diplomat 3" width="500" height="670" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 3 Overview of the infection flow </em></p>
<p>The document “2015.12.11_сроки СГГ 2015 в Уфе.doc.doc” exploits CVE-2012-0158 to drop a decoy file “~$.doc” and the actual payload “DW20.exe”. The decoy is a blank document with the meta data stripped.</p>
<p>The payload (DW20.exe) is a self-extracting (SFX) RAR archive that contains the following files:</p>
<p><em>RasTls.exe<br />
</em><em>rastls.dll<br />
</em><em>Sycmentec.config</em></p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-4.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11888 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-4-500x290.png" alt="diplomat 4" width="500" height="290" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 4 The payload(DW20.exe) is a SFX RAR archive</em></p>
<p>The SFX RAR uses the following configuration to launch the embedded executable, which is a legitimate application created by Symantec that will side load the rastls.dll DLL:</p>
<p><em>Setup=RasTls.exe</em><br />
<em>TempMode</em><br />
<em>Silent=1</em><br />
<em>Overwrite=1</em></p>
<p>The figure below shows that the config file, ‘Sycmentec.config’ is encrypted.</p>
<p>The ‘Sycmentec.config’ file can be decrypted using a single byte XOR algorithm using ‘0x77’ as a key.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-5.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11889 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-5-500x393.png" alt="diplomat 5" width="500" height="393" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 5 Encrypted </em><em>‘Sycmentec</em><em>.config’file</em></p>
<p>The ‘rastls.dll’ DLL will load and decrypt this file. The decrypted data starts with shellcode that is responsible for loading an embedded DLL and executing it.</p>
<p>Figure 6 shows the decrypted ‘Sycmentec.config’file containing an embedded DLL.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-6.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11890 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-6-500x393.png" alt="diplomat 6" width="500" height="393" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 6 Decrypted </em><em>‘</em><em>Sycmentec.config’ file contains an embedded DLL</em></p>
<p>The embedded DLL is the functional payload, which is a variant of the NetTraveler Trojan that has the following attributes:</p>
<table width="391">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>Size</strong></td>
<td width="318">52736 bytes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>Type</strong></td>
<td width="318">PE32 executable (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386, for MS Windows</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>Architecture </strong></td>
<td width="318">32 Bits binary</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>MD5</strong></td>
<td width="318">3e3df4fe831d87d7f52f14933e464fc3</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>SHA1</strong></td>
<td width="318">cce65a0b67674a313091a947506ceb91d30605ad</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>SHA256</strong></td>
<td width="318">3b4e4d7a0b1185a45968d90ffe6346f4621116d14dbf88b5138040acc022c757</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>ssdeep</strong></td>
<td width="318">1536:jxKW1S8mWKFU7U9lYjhjXwVqTvS/G405:wCBmUw9lAhLWqW/G40</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>imphash</strong></td>
<td width="318">85ce31f87f06b02fec915d33d82958e8</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>Date</strong></td>
<td width="318">0x564B2B07 [Tue Nov 17 13:26:31 2015 UTC]</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>CRC:(Claimed)</strong></td>
<td width="318">0x0, (Actual): 0x19be0 [SUSPICIOUS]</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>Packers</strong></td>
<td width="318">Armadillo v1.xx - v2.xx</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="73"><strong>Entry Point</strong></td>
<td width="318">0x1000970b .text 1/5</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p><em>Table 1 Attributes of the embedded DLL (NetTraveler)</em></p>
<p>The first execution of this NetTraveler Trojan starts off with an installation process. Like previous versions, this NetTraveler sample writes its configuration to a file, in this case the configuration is written to a file named "config.dat".</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-7.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11891 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-7-500x268.png" alt="diplomat 7" width="500" height="268" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 7 NetTraveler writes the configuration to </em><em>‘</em><em>config.dat’ file</em></p>
<p>During execution, NetTraveler creates a mutex of ‘YOYWOW!657’, as shown in Figure 8 below to avoid running multiple instances of its code.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-8.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11892 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-8-500x105.png" alt="diplomat 8" width="500" height="105" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 8 Mutex created for this NetTraveler payload</em></p>
<p>The code then enumerates the 'netsvcs' services, which are services that run within the process space of svchost.exe, specifically ignoring services named ‘6to4’ and ‘Ias’ as these services have been used by other malware families.</p>
<p>When it finds another netsvcs service with a name not matching these two names, it will delete the file associated with the service and copy the ‘rastls.dll’ file to that folder using ‘&lt;service name&gt;ve.dll’ as the filename as shown in Figure 9 below.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-9.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11893 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-9-500x644.png" alt="diplomat 9" width="500" height="644" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 9 Code enumerating ‘netsvcs’ services</em></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-10.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-11894 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-10.png" alt="diplomat 10" width="450" height="452" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-10.png 450w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-10-150x150.png 150w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-10-300x300.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-10-370x372.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 450px) 100vw, 450px" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 10 Renamed ‘rastls.dll’ DLL</em></p>
<p> The malware will then change the binary path of the service to point to this new filename and copies the "Sycmentec.config" file to the same folder and the ‘config.dat’ file to the following location:</p>
<p><em>c:\windows\system\CERTAPL.DLL</em></p>
<p>The NetTraveler payload relies on the ‘rastls.dll’ file to obtain its C2 server. At first glance, the NetTraveler payload appears as if it will use the following URL for its C2 server:</p>
<p><em>http://192.168.3[.]201/downloader2013/asp/downloader.asp</em></p>
<p>However, the NetTraveler payload reads the last ‘0xb0’ bytes from the rastls.dll file and uses it to create the "config.dat" file that is later saved to "CERTAPL.DLL". This technique hides the true C2 server from researchers that do not have access to both the rastls.dll and Sycmentec.config files.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-11.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11895 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-11-500x511.png" alt="diplomat 11" width="500" height="511" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 11 Code snippet showing NetTraveler obtaining its configuration from rastls.dll.</em></p>
<p>The configuration file is structured as an ".ini" file as the Trojan uses GetPrivateProfileStringA to parse the contents. The configuration file has the following contents:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
[OOOOOO]
U00P=r^?&lt;80&gt;}H&gt;?&lt;88&gt;&lt;89&gt;&lt;8A&gt;B&lt;8B&gt;&lt;85&gt;|&lt;86&gt;&lt;87&gt;&lt;89&gt;&lt;91&gt;&lt;8B&gt;&lt;90&gt;&lt;92&gt;&lt;88&gt;N&lt;84&gt;&lt;91&gt;&lt;90&gt;S&lt;94&gt;&lt;96&gt;&lt;9B&gt;&lt;8C&gt;&lt;8E&gt;&lt;9E&gt;Z&lt;95&gt;&lt;9B&gt;&lt;92&gt;&lt;94&gt;&lt;A8&gt;_&lt;93&gt;&lt;A6&gt;&lt;A4&gt;
K00P=XLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\]^_`abcdefghiv
P00D=5
F00G=True
MM1=0
MM6=1</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-1">1</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-2">2</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-3">3</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-4">4</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-5">5</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-6">6</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-7">7</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-cn">8B</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">85</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-sy">|</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">86</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">87</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">89</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">91</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">8B</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">90</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">92</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">88</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-i">N</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">84</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">91</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">90</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-i">S</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">94</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">96</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">9B</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">8C</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">8E</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">9E</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-i">Z</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">95</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">9B</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">92</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">94</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-i">A8</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-i">_</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-cn">93</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-i">A6</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-i">A4</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-3"><span class="crayon-i">K00P</span>=<span class="crayon-i">XLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ</span><span class="crayon-sy">[</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">]</span>^<span class="crayon-i">_</span><span class="crayon-sy">`</span><span class="crayon-e">abcdefghiv</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-4"><span class="crayon-i">P00D</span>=<span class="crayon-cn">5</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-5"><span class="crayon-i">F00G</span>=<span class="crayon-t">True</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-6"><span class="crayon-i">MM1</span>=<span class="crayon-cn">0</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaa3660354368-7"><span class="crayon-i">MM6</span>=<span class="crayon-cn">1</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0003 seconds] -->
<p>Unit 42 analyzed the sample and found the following configuration fields that could appear in the CERTAPL.DLL configuration file and a brief description of each field:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-67622183beaad218920016" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
U00P = C2 URL
K00P = Key for DES
P00D = Sleep interval in minutes
F00G = Boolean to determine if sample should use proxy to communicate with C2 server
MM1 = 0 or 1 if proxy is configured or not.
MM3 = Port for configured proxy
MM4 = Username for configured proxy
MM5 = Password for configured proxy
MM6 = 1 if Trojan is installed correctly</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-1">1</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-2">2</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-3">3</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-4">4</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-5">5</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-6">6</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-7">7</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-8">8</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-9">9</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-1"><span class="crayon-i">U00P</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">C2 </span><span class="crayon-e">URL</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-2"><span class="crayon-i">K00P</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">Key </span><span class="crayon-st">for</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">DES</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-3"><span class="crayon-i">P00D</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">Sleep </span><span class="crayon-e">interval </span><span class="crayon-st">in</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">minutes</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-4"><span class="crayon-i">F00G</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-t">Boolean</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">to</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">determine </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">sample </span><span class="crayon-e">should </span><span class="crayon-st">use</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">proxy </span><span class="crayon-st">to</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">communicate </span><span class="crayon-e">with </span><span class="crayon-e">C2 </span><span class="crayon-e">server</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-5"><span class="crayon-i">MM1</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">or</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">proxy </span><span class="crayon-st">is</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">configured </span><span class="crayon-st">or</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">not</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-6"><span class="crayon-i">MM3</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">Port </span><span class="crayon-st">for</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">configured </span><span class="crayon-e">proxy</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-7"><span class="crayon-i">MM4</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">Username </span><span class="crayon-st">for</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">configured </span><span class="crayon-e">proxy</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-8"><span class="crayon-i">MM5</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">Password </span><span class="crayon-st">for</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">configured </span><span class="crayon-e">proxy</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaad218920016-9"><span class="crayon-i">MM6</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">if</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">Trojan </span><span class="crayon-st">is</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">installed </span><span class="crayon-i">correctly</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0002 seconds] -->
<p>The "U00P" and "K00P" values are decrypted using a simple algorithm that subtracts the index and then subtracts ten from each character, which is depicted in the following:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
def subtraction_algo(ct):
  out = ""
  i = 0
  for e in ct:
    out += chr(ord(e)-i-10)
    i += 1
  return out</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-1">1</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-2">2</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-3">3</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-4">4</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-5">5</div><div class="crayon-num crayon-striped-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-6">6</div><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-7">7</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-1"><span class="crayon-e">def </span><span class="crayon-e">subtraction_algo</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">ct</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-2"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">out</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">""</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-3"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">i</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">0</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-4"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-st">for</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">e</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">in</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">ct</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-5"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">out</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>+=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">chr</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-e">ord</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-i">e</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span>-<span class="crayon-i">i</span>-<span class="crayon-cn">10</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-6"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-i">i</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>+=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-cn">1</span></div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-67622183beaaf030439531-7"><span class="crayon-h">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span class="crayon-st">return</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-i">out</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0001 seconds] -->
<p>These two fields decrypt to the following, the U00P value being the C2 URL and the K00P value being the basis for an encryption key for the DES algorithm:</p>
<p><em>U00P: http://www.voennovosti.com/optdet/index.asp (decrypted)</em></p>
<p><em>K00P: NAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAM (decrypted)</em></p>
<p>The C2 server will respond to requests issued by the Trojan with commands to carry out activities on the compromised system. We analyzed the code within NetTraveler that handles commands issued by the C2 server and found four available commands that are listed in Table 2.</p>
<table width="385">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td width="199"><strong>Command</strong></td>
<td width="186"><strong>Description</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="199">&lt;Unique System ID&gt;:UNINSTALL</td>
<td width="186">Deletes %APPDATA%\cert2013.dat and %STARTUP%\consent.lnk and exits the process. This attempts to uninstall the Trojan, but will not work as the filenames are not used by this version of NetTraveler</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="199">&lt;Unique System ID&gt;:RUN_REBOOT</td>
<td width="186">Reboots the system</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="199">&lt;Unique System ID&gt;:RUN_STARTUP</td>
<td width="186">Downloads a file to %TEMP%\Temp.bmp and copies it to the startup folder</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="199">&lt;Unique System ID&gt;:RUN_DIRECT</td>
<td width="186">Download a file to %TEMP%\tmp.bmp and execute it</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p><em>Table 2 Commands available within NetTraveler and a description of their functionality</em></p>
<h3>INFRASTRUCTURE</h3>
<p>At the time of analysis, the domain voennovosti[.]com was resolving to IP ‘98.126.38[.]107’, which is hosted by Krypt Technologies. A <a href="https://kasperskycontenthub.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/vlpdfs/kaspersky-the-net-traveler-part1-final.pdf">report</a> published by Kaspersky Labs in 2011 on NetTraveler also mentions the C2 servers were being hosted by Krypt Technolgies. This web hosting service provider continues to be the hosting provider of choice for the threat actors behind NetTraveler.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-12.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11896 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-12-500x218.png" alt="diplomat 12" width="500" height="218" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 12 DNS query for voennovosti[.]com resolves to ‘98.126.38.107’</em></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-13.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-11897 lozad"  data-src="http://blog.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/diplomat-13-500x364.png" alt="diplomat 13" width="500" height="364" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Figure 13 Encoded network communications</em></p>
<h3>CONCLUSION</h3>
<p>NetTraveler has been used to target diplomats, embassies and government institutions for over a decade, and remains the tool of choice by the adversaries behind these cyber espionage campaigns. The use of NetTraveler for such a long period of time shows its effectiveness and success by the adversaries in targeting their victims with impunity.</p>
<p>As seen in this case, the threat actors continue to evolve and employ new techniques within their modus operandi, like ‘DLL side-loading’ to install malware. It is likely that the use of ‘DLL side loading’ attack technique will increase due to it’s effectiveness to bypass traditional security systems.</p>
<p>It is essential to raise awareness on such attacks to better protect organizations from adversaries who maybe backed by nation states.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/products/technologies/wildfire.html">WildFire</a> correctly classifies NetTraveler as malicious. <a href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/products/platforms/subscriptions/autofocus.html">AutoFocus</a> tags are created to identify NetTraveler samples and respective IOCs are added to Palo Alto Networks <a href="https://paloaltonetworks.com/solutions/initiative/threat-prevention.html">Threat Prevention</a>.</p>
<h3>INDICATORS</h3>
<table width="384">
<tbody>
<tr>

</tr>
<tr>

</tr>
<tr>
<td width="286">001fff6c09497f56532e83e998aaa80690a668883b6655129d408dd098bd1b4b</td>

</tr>

<p><strong>Command and Control</strong></p>
<p>voennovosti[.]com<br />
98.126.38[.]107</p>

              <div class="card-content">
                <div class="card-content__wrapper">
                  <a class="card-category" href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/category/threat-research/" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:related-resources:FrostyGoop’s Zoom-In: A Closer Look into the Malware Artifacts, Behaviors and Network Communications:Threat Research"><span class=""><img class="lozad" data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/icon-threat-research.svg" alt=" category icon">Threat Research</span></a>                        <span class="post-pub-date"><time datetime="2024-11-19T11:00:15+00:00">November 19, 2024</time></span>
                  <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/frostygoop-malware-analysis/" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:related-resources:FrostyGoop’s Zoom-In: A Closer Look into the Malware Artifacts, Behaviors and Network Communications">
                    <h4 class="post-title">FrostyGoop’s Zoom-In: A Closer Look into the Malware Artifacts, Behaviors and Network Communications</h4>
                  </a>
                  <ul class="card-tags" role="list">
				<li role="listitem">
					<a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/bustleberm/" title="BUSTLEBERM" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:related-resources:FrostyGoop’s Zoom-In: A Closer Look into the Malware Artifacts, Behaviors and Network Communications:BUSTLEBERM">BUSTLEBERM</a>
				</li>
				<li role="listitem">
					<a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/frostygoop/" title="FrostyGoop" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:related-resources:FrostyGoop’s Zoom-In: A Closer Look into the Malware Artifacts, Behaviors and Network Communications:FrostyGoop">FrostyGoop</a>
				</li>
				<li role="listitem">
					<a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/go/" title="Go" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:related-resources:FrostyGoop’s Zoom-In: A Closer Look into the Malware Artifacts, Behaviors and Network Communications:Go">Go</a>
				</li></ul>                </div>
                <div class="card-content__link">
                                    <a class="hyperlink" href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/frostygoop-malware-analysis/" title="FrostyGoop’s Zoom-In: A Closer Look into the Malware Artifacts, Behaviors and Network Communications" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:related-resources:FrostyGoop’s Zoom-In: A Closer Look into the Malware Artifacts, Behaviors and Network Communications:read now">

                  </a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>

                  </a>
                  <ul class="card-tags" role="list">
				<li role="listitem">
					<a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/backdoor/" title="backdoor" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="nettraveler-spear-phishing-email-targets-diplomat-of-uzbekistan:related-resources:Inside SnipBot: The Latest RomCom Malware Variant:backdoor">Backdoor</a>
